question: Question_04_(e)
statement:
Consider the Fourier series

\[t^2 - t = \sum_{n = -\infty}^\infty c_ne^{2\pi int}\]

for $0 \leq t \leq 1$.

\textbf{(e)} Find the value of

\[\int_0^1 \cos(2\pi t)(t^2-t)\,dt\]

Hint: Use that
$\displaystyle \cos(2\pi t) = (1/2)(e^{2\pi it}+e^{-2\pi it})$
hints:
Express the integral $\int_{0}^{1} \cos(2\pi t)(t^2-t)\,dt$ in terms of
\emph{c\textsubscript{-1}} and \emph{c\textsubscript{1}}. Then, plug
\emph{n = -1} and \emph{n = 1} in the formular for
\emph{c\textsubscript{n}} given in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2012/Question_04_(d)}{part
(d)}.
